data.text:
Grettell Valdez has a net worth of

$1.5 Million

Grettell Valdez Wiki Biography

Grettell Valdez was born as Grettell Valeria Valdez Jimenez on July 8, 1976, in Queretaro, Mexico. She is an actress, best known for her role as Lucía Valderrama Covarrubias in the TV series “Angel Rebelde” and as Maria Zamudio in the TV series “Lo Que La Vida Me Robó”, among other roles throughout her career.

Her estimated net worth as of early 2018 is $1.5 million, accumulated through her successful career, which began in the early ’90s.

Grettell Valdez Net Worth $1.5 Million

Information about Grettell’s early life and education is unfortunately not available, but her successful career has been well-documented.

She made her acting debut in the TV series “Sin Ti” in 1997 and ventured into films with her role as Edecan in the 2001 film “Un Mundo Raro”. She gained prominence in 2004 with the role of Lucia Valderrama Covarrubias in the telenovela “Angel Rebelde”, which significantly contributed to her popularity and net worth. She continued to secure supporting roles in various soap operas and telenovelas, further enhancing her net worth. Notable among these are her roles in “Heridas De Amor” (2006), “Lola, Erase Una Vez” (2007-2008), “Camaleones” (2009-2010), and “Amorcito Corazon” (2011). In 2013, she portrayed Maria Zamudio, the main antagonist in the popular soap opera “Lo Que La Vida Me Robo”, further boosting her net worth.

Subsequently, Grettell appeared in several successful telenovelas, including “Lo Imperdonable” (2015), “Las Amazonas” (2016), and “Tenias Que See Tu” (2017), establishing herself as one of the most popular Latin actresses.

As for her personal life, Grettell was married to actor and singer Patricio Borghetti from 2004 to 2010 and they have a son named Santino. After her divorce, she dated various Latin celebrities, including Sebastian Zurita and Antonio Carrete. Currently, she is reported to be single.
